      • listFilesAndPathsFromRootDir

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File[]> listFilesAndPathsFromRootDir​(java.io.File rootDir)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.

      • listFilesAndPathsFromRootDir

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File[]> listFilesAndPathsFromRootDir​(java.io.File rootDir,
                                                                               boolean listDirs)
                                                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                               java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Lists all files in a dir. Outputs an ArrayList containing an array of File objects of length 2. The first element contains the path of the file. The second element contains the path of the location in the file relative to the given rootDir. Furthermore is guarenteed that: - For every directory that all its children (sub-dirs included) are listed directly below its own entry. - Also, when one file occures after any directory, which is not a child of that directory, then all children (and all sub-children) of that directory are already listed. - No other assumptions regarding file-order can be made on the output.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • listFilesAndPathsFromRootDir

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File[]> listFilesAndPathsFromRootDir​(java.io.File rootDir,
                                                                               java.lang.String pathSoFar,
                                                                               boolean listDirs)
                                                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                               java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Parameters:
        rootDir -
        pathSoFar -
        listDirs -
        Returns:
        Throws:

        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • createZip

        public static void createZip​(java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File[]> filesAndDirs,
                             java.io.File zipFile,
                             java.io.File... ignoreFiles)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             java.util.zip.ZipException
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Creates a zip file. The input ArrayList contains an array of File objects of length 2. The first element contains the path of the file. The second element contains the path of the location in the zip.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.io.IOException
        java.util.zip.ZipException

      • createZip

        public static void createZip​(java.io.File[] inFiles,
                             java.io.File[] pathInZip,
                             java.io.File zipFile,
                             java.io.File... ignoreFiles)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             java.util.zip.ZipException
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Packs an array of files in a zip file. The pathInZip array denotes where each file should be stored in the zip. If pathInZip equals null then all files will be stored at the root of the zip file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.io.IOException
        java.util.zip.ZipException
